explanation: literary; to add something decorative to a person or thing
sentence: The bride's hair was adorned with white flowers.
sentence_gap: The bride's hair was _______ with white flowers.

explanation: suitable or appropriate in the circumstances
sentence: Chris’s apt comments summed up our opinions.
sentence_gap: Chris’s ___ comments summed up our opinions.

explanation: to confuse, annoy, or cause problems or difficulties for someone or something
sentence: Ever since I started playing tennis, I've been bedevilled by back pains.
sentence_gap: Ever since I started playing tennis, I've been __________ by back pains.

explanation: wanting to fight or argue
sentence: She was so belligerent that I gave up trying to explain.
sentence_gap: She was so ___________ that I gave up trying to explain.

explanation: formal; to arrange for money or property to be given to somebody after your death
sentence: Picasso bequeathed most of his paintings and sculptures to Spain and France.
sentence_gap: Picasso __________ most of his paintings and sculptures to Spain and France.

sentence: They are uneducated chauvinists who think men rule in society.
sentence_gap: They are uneducated ___________ who think men rule in society.

explanation: a structure like a net of sticky silk threads made by a spider for catching insects
sentence: Thick cobwebs hung in the dusty corners.
sentence_gap: Thick _______ hung in the dusty corners.

explanation: a chemical that combines two or more elements; something consisting of two or more different parts
sentence: Salt is a compound of sodium and chlorine. Then there was his manner, a curious compound of humor and severity.
sentence_gap: Salt is a ________ of sodium and chlorine. Then there was his manner, a curious ________ of humor and severity.

explanation: happening, developing, or moving slowly or gradually
sentence: We are totally against any form of creeping Socialism.
sentence_gap: We are totally against any form of ________ Socialism.

explanation: old use; to rescue someone from something bad
sentence: Deliver us from evil.
sentence_gap: _______ us from evil.

explanation: without money, food, a home, or possessions
sentence: The floods left thousands of people destitute.
sentence_gap: The floods left thousands of people _________.

explanation: something that stops people doing something because they are afraid of what will happen if they do
sentence: They've installed a security camera as a deterrent to thieves.
sentence_gap: They've installed a security camera as a _________ to thieves.

explanation: no longer satisfied with your situation, organization, belief, etc. and therefore not loyal to it
sentence: Some disaffected members left to form a new party.
sentence_gap: Some ___________ members left to form a new party.

explanation: extremely sad and disappointed
sentence: The players were disconsolate after losing what should have been an easy game.
sentence_gap: The players were ____________ after losing what should have been an easy game.

explanation: the range of distance within which it is possible to be heard or to hear what someone is saying
sentence: Wait till she's out of earshot before you say anything.
sentence_gap: Wait till she's out of _______ before you say anything.

translated: plątać się, borykać się z kłopotami
explanation: to experience great difficulties or be completely unable to decide what to do or say next
sentence: He lost the next page of his speech and floundered around for a few seconds.
sentence_gap: He lost the next page of his speech and __________ around for a few seconds.

explanation: informal; something good that has happened that is the result of chance instead of skill or planning
sentence: The first goal was just a fluke.
sentence_gap: The first goal was just a _____.

explanation: a bird of a type that is used to produce meat or eggs
sentence: Domestic and wild fowl are generally abundant.
sentence_gap: Domestic and wild ____ are generally abundant.

explanation: friendly and cheerful
sentence: The teacher has a genial manner.
sentence_gap: The teacher has a ______ manner.

explanation: informal; acting or speaking in a way intended to attract the good opinion of other people who are watching
sentence: Experts criticized the program as mere grandstanding by corporations and local officials.
sentence_gap: Experts criticized the program as mere _____________ by corporations and local officials.

explanation: an insect in the stage when it has just come out of its egg
sentence: A grub looks like a short, fat worm.
sentence_gap: A ____ looks like a short, fat worm.

explanation: the edge of a piece of cloth, such as the bottom edge of a skirt or dress, that is folded over and sewn so that it does not develop loose threads
sentence: A hem is a folded and sewn piece of fabric on the edge.
sentence_gap: A ___ is a folded and sewn piece of fabric on the edge.

explanation: extremely ugly or bad
sentence: They've just built some hideous new apartment blocks on the seafront.
sentence_gap: They've just built some _______ new apartment blocks on the seafront.

explanation: the country where a person was born
sentence: Many refugees have been forced to flee their homeland.
sentence_gap: Many refugees have been forced to flee their ________.

explanation: a ring of wood, metal, or plastic
sentence: The dogs had been trained to jump through hoops.
sentence_gap: The dogs had been trained to jump through _____.

explanation: formal; to put something or someone at risk or in danger of being harmed or destroyed
sentence: A police raid would imperil the lives of the hostages.
sentence_gap: A police raid would _______ the lives of the hostages.

explanation: likely to do something suddenly, without considering the results of your actions
sentence: He's so impetuous - why can't he think things over before he rushes into them?
sentence_gap: He's so _________ - why can't he think things over before he rushes into them?

explanation: impossible to forget or remove
sentence: His performance of Hamlet left an indelible impression on all who saw it. The blood had left an indelible mark on her shirt.
sentence_gap: His performance of Hamlet left an _________ impression on all who saw it. The blood had left an _________ mark on her shirt.

explanation: formal; (especially of a problem) so great or severe that it cannot be defeated or dealt with successfully
sentence: Things which defeated you a short time ago are no longer insuperable.
sentence_gap: Things which defeated you a short time ago are no longer ___________.

explanation: an evergreen plant that often grows up trees or buildings
sentence: Ivy covered the broken walls.
sentence_gap: ___ covered the broken walls.

explanation: any part of an organ that seems to be separate in some way from the rest, especially one of the parts of the brain, lungs, or liver
sentence: The x-rays were conclusive and indicated a bad infection in the lower lobe of one lung.
sentence_gap: The x-rays were conclusive and indicated a bad infection in the lower ____ of one lung.

explanation: used to decribe someone who behaves as if they are better than other people
sentence: He dismissed us with a lordly gesture.
sentence_gap: He dismissed us with a ______ gesture.

explanation: an ancient musical instrument consisting of a U-shaped frame with strings attached to it
sentence: They played the lyre, but they never played the harp.
sentence_gap: They played the ____, but they never played the harp.

explanation: to destroy something by twisting it with force or tearing it into pieces so that its original form is completely changed
sentence: My sweater got mangled in the washing machine.
sentence_gap: My sweater got _______ in the washing machine.

explanation: to say something in a soft, quiet voice that is difficult to hear or understand
sentence: He was murmuring to himself.
sentence_gap: He was _________ to himself.

explanation: a small cut in a surface or an edge
sentence: Apart from a few nicks in the varnish, the guitar is in very good condition.
sentence_gap: Apart from a few _____ in the varnish, the guitar is in very good condition.

explanation: old-fashioned; a stupid, rude, or awkward person, especially a man
sentence: Watch that cup, you clumsy oaf!
sentence_gap: Watch that cup, you clumsy ___!

explanation: reaching out as far as possible
sentence: He ran up to her, his arms outstretched.
sentence_gap: He ran up to her, his arms ____________.

explanation: to defeat or remove someone from power, using force
sentence: They were accused of plotting to overthrow the government.
sentence_gap: They were accused of plotting to _________ the government.

explanation: old-fashioned; very fast and not organized
sentence: At the sound of the alarm bell, the customers ran pell-mell for the doors.
sentence_gap: At the sound of the alarm bell, the customers ran _________ for the doors.

explanation: lasting a very long time, or happening repeatedly or all the time
sentence: The film "White Christmas" is a perennial favorite.
sentence_gap: The film "White Christmas" is a _________ favorite.

explanation: formal; present or noticeable in every part of a thing or place
sentence: A sense of social change is pervasive in her novels.
sentence_gap: A sense of social change is _________ in her novels.

explanation: formal; in a way that is too sudden and done without thinking
sentence: Scientists are annoyed that the research programme has been abandoned so precipitately.

explanation: formal; more important, more successful, or of a higher standard than others
sentence: He was the preeminent scientist of his day.
sentence_gap: He was the __________ scientist of his day.

explanation: a joke that you make by using a word that has two meanings
sentence: If I had a buck for every flat I fixed, I could retire...no pun intended.
sentence_gap: If I had a buck for every flat I fixed, I could retire...no ___ intended.

explanation: an area of soft, wet ground that you sink into if you try to walk on it; a difficult and dangerous situation
sentence: The heavy rain soon turned the field into a quagmire. Since the coup, the country has sunk deeper into a quagmire of violence and lawlessness.
sentence_gap: The heavy rain soon turned the field into a ________. Since the coup, the country has sunk deeper into a ________ of violence and lawlessness.

explanation: formal; ordinary; typical of what happens every day
sentence: Television has become part of our quotidian existence.
sentence_gap: Television has become part of our _________ existence.

explanation: formal; an amount of money that you send to someone
sentence: She sends a small remittance home to her parents each month.
sentence_gap: She sends a small __________ home to her parents each month.

explanation: literary; a state of rest, sleep, or feeling calm
sentence: The first rays of morning sun disturbed their repose.
sentence_gap: The first rays of morning sun disturbed their ______.

explanation: the fact that two people or things look like each other or are similar in some other way
sentence: There was a clear family resemblance between all the brothers.
sentence_gap: There was a clear family ___________ between all the brothers.

explanation: formal; the return of objects that were stolen or lost
sentence: They are demanding the restitution of ancient treasures that were removed from the country in the 16th century.
sentence_gap: They are demanding the ___________ of ancient treasures that were removed from the country in the 16th century.

explanation: a tube that you hold in your mouth to help you breathe if you are swimming with your face underwater
sentence: He was wearing a mask and snorkel and a diving suit.
sentence_gap: He was wearing a mask and _______ and a diving suit.

sentence: There are some groves of pine and spruce trees on the sea side of the road here.
sentence_gap: There are some groves of pine and ______ trees on the sea side of the road here.

explanation: an occasion when many large animals or many people suddenly all move quickly and in an uncontrolled way, usually in the same direction at the same time, especially because of fear
sentence: Two shoppers were injured in the stampede as shop doors opened on the first day of the sale.
sentence_gap: Two shoppers were injured in the ________ as shop doors opened on the first day of the sale.

explanation: (of an injury, etc.) to form or give out a thick, yellow liquid because of infection
sentence: Suppurating wounds are also a potential source of environmental contamination with infectious bacilli.
sentence_gap: ___________ wounds are also a potential source of environmental contamination with infectious bacilli.

explanation: (especially of a vehicle) to change direction suddenly, especially in order to avoid hitting someone or something
sentence: The bus driver swerved to avoid hitting a cyclist.
sentence_gap: The bus driver _______ to avoid hitting a cyclist.

explanation: formal; having the same bad effect as something else
sentence: Her refusal to answer was tantamount to an admission of guilt.
sentence_gap: Her refusal to answer was __________ to an admission of guilt.

explanation: looking bright and attractive but in fact cheap and of low quality
sentence: Their ugly front garden and tacky, tawdry lights fail to reflect our village image.
sentence_gap: Their ugly front garden and tacky, ______ lights fail to reflect our village image.

explanation: easily annoyed and not patient
sentence: Prodi became more than a little testy when I raised the subject.
sentence_gap: Prodi became more than a little _____ when I raised the subject.

explanation: formal; immediately after the situation mentioned; as a direct result of the situation mentioned
sentence: The audience thereupon rose cheering to their feet.
sentence_gap: The audience _________ rose cheering to their feet.

sentence: Fresh or dried spices like oregano, basil, dill or thyme are common.
sentence_gap: Fresh or dried spices like oregano, basil, dill or _____ are common.

explanation: a large stone structure or underground room where someone, especially an important person, is buried
sentence: When they opened up the tomb they found treasure beyond their wildest dreams.
sentence_gap: When they opened up the ____ they found treasure beyond their wildest dreams.

explanation: to become unsteady and fall down; to make something do this
sentence: He brushed past, toppling her from her stool.
sentence_gap: He brushed past, ________ her from her stool.

explanation: formal; the act or process of breaking a law or moral rule, or an example of this
sentence: Adolescence is a period marked by fascination with the transgression of rules.

explanation: soldiers, especially in large groups
sentence: They announced the withdrawal of 12,000 troops from the area.
sentence_gap: They announced the withdrawal of 12,000 ______ from the area.

explanation: a mass of bushes, small trees, and plants, especially growing under the trees in a forest
sentence: Police discovered the body hidden in thick undergrowth.
sentence_gap: Police discovered the body hidden in thick ___________.

explanation: expressing strong feelings, or shown by strong feelings or great energy or force
sentence: Despite vehement opposition from his family, he quit school and became an actor.

explanation: the edge or border of something
sentence: They set up camp on the verge of the desert.

explanation: formal; often involved in and eager to start wars
sentence: It has often been said, perhaps unfairly, that they are a warlike nation.
sentence_gap: It has often been said, perhaps unfairly, that they are a _______ nation.

explanation: to stop someone who is going somewhere, especially in order to talk to them or attack them
sentence: I meant to leave earlier but I was waylaid on the way out of a meeting by my manager.
sentence_gap: I meant to leave earlier but I was _______ on the way out of a meeting by my manager.
